info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 3:38AM CDT until April 23 at 3:42AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas...
Neosho River near Parsons affecting Neosho and Labette Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Neosho River near Parsons.
* WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flood waters spread over fields to a distance of 1 and one fourth miles. Several county roads, mainly along the left bank are inundated. Several residents which live along the right bank in the vicinity of Highway 400 may experience water entering their homes at basement levels.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 22.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 345 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
